8BED49E3BF6A4FE4AD2838A3BA3C5B49.description: Assess and revise action plans as necessary.

D9343A60FE044233AD22C8465883F2D7.description: Carry out action plans in ways that affirm personal standards.

90B6906255EA4C5BA4327F670A98B771.description: Use specific criteria to evaluate the design elements of the action plans.

0AE7ABC5F5E743E884BEFCBA6AEFD649.description: Examine the traits and skills of a support person who can/will support individual action plans.

074EA97036D9423F9D5D46745485D329.description: Describe the elements of a well-designed action plan.

9724C369CF484C1B984FA4A7ED977100.description: Develop, with guidance, criteria to assess action plans that affirm personal standards.

64FB4EB445794A7AB134759A9DE0880A.description: Design and implement (with guidance) two six-day action plans that reflect affirmation of personal standards related to decision making, relationships, noncurable infections, stress management, body image, safety, and health promotions.

E328EE457B0F44DC96A08B327B756558.description: Apply decisions that will improve personal health and/or the health of others.

1F26FF4AE56E4E4588EB199ECC7FF33B.description: Construct personal goals, related to affirming standards, in each unit of study.

34CA63EA97CF469F854721785618D503.description: Evaluate, based on specific criteria, strategies for embracing the health opportunities and/or addressing the health challenges related to each unit of study.

103AC647D9BA487A9D743F9FD5AFF62A.description: Identify and recognize health opportunities and/or challenges related to each unit of study.

B7A63E2F009D4487B11144D6E14144E3.description: Examine health opportunities and challenges to establish personal goal statements related to healthy relationships, noncurable infections, stress management, body image, safety, and health promotions.

F4FE7E2037C94EF4A5673CA67F7F01DA.description: Investigate strategies and decisions to affirm personal standards.

3290308043AF49EB8137147C7F4F8D93.description: Recognize when personal standards might be at risk.

836E162928834FB680F4EAC412D358B0.description: Decide which factors have the greatest influence on one’s personal standards.

9B6932828D9E4DC889608EA04814F58D.description: Examine the factors that influence decision-making (both positive and negative).

F6289E37AFE648B2897BF2D737950392.description: Select an effective decision-making model to use.

5A33A2407784462B930CE68C081F21BD.description: Distinguish similarities and differences in a variety of decision-making models.

CE5460A936FF498A8D20A58DF8BFC243.description: Assess the role of personal standards in decision making related to healthy relationships, non-curable infections, stress management, body image, safety, and health promotions.

8BB83D8BB601478AA6A479ED29D73AEF.description: Make informed decisions based on health-related knowledge.

B2D619B6C1CB4DB9BBD474DE1AD3C53A.description: Propose and investigate other legislation that would target health-compromising messaging.

E5F3B9C176824FACABBC1165572707AF.description: Analyze the impact of tobacco control legislation on tobacco industry messaging.

A33D515647CA4BE0B4D66E9C58C9A742.description: Analyze the perceived and the “hidden” purposes as to why manufacturers and industries (e.g., tobacco, diet plans, clothing) advertise.

AFA771AE2AA1412F87C924EC60B8AFF5.description: Determine why young people are a valuable market for numerous industries and manufacturers.

E82EAD0939454C98B83674CCFE545039.description: Investigate the influence of health promotions and advertising on youth attitudes and behaviours.

ED5B5FE6E081444CB47DEE533C0AC1CB.description: Compare the strategies used by industries and agencies that encourage health-enhancing behaviours to those that encourage health-compromising behaviours.

3D449161D84D4AB7AC5D20748776B29E.description: Analyze the marketing and promotional vehicles/strategies used by companies and industries (including the tobacco industry) to encourage young people to use/buy their products and/or to challenge young people’s personal standards.

F17192CC0EE8461482A73B8D3EA4EE38.description: Examine and categorize the advertising and related promotions in the school and community (e.g., target audience, product promotion).

10C2A9E2ACEB40B98F1F2B9A6F23F602.description: Identify sources of, and evaluate information related to, the marketing strategies used by a variety of industries and agencies to target youth.

87B158281A14440BA48EA8DF3350129A.description: Identify and evaluate local, provincial, and national health promotions.

D5BE0BC20B9346DC89FAACDDF315E0E7.description: Assess how health promotions and advertising (related to but not limited to tobacco, alcohol, diabetes, and HIV) influence personal standards and behaviours and determine how and why certain groups of consumers (e.g., youth as ‘replacement’ smokers) are targeted.

560EB0D0BB604D5B849AA704F96E7B10.description: Defend the statement “community safety is everyone’s responsibility”.

9C8E388744C642E1A6AC9F070D9CFB85.description: Affirm personal standards with respect to individual rights and responsibilities for creating and supporting safe environments.

0684226125EE4846A4038F2C64B2D56B.description: Determine when safety and personal standards about individual responsibility for safety and accident prevention may be challenged.

871A14B85252477A9C40C7985AB1A9B4.description: Examine the possible physical, social, and emotional consequences of not understanding and/or not following safety rules, regulations, and laws.

70E15B2BD4944768A28E9EBF1D0D0537.description: Evaluate the rights and responsibilities associated with rules, regulations, and laws related to a variety of safety practices to create healthy and safe community environments (e.g., tobacco legislation, personal protective equipment).

9E8DEB09FFAB485A96DEC55163BA7237.description: Investigate and analyze the intent of the rules, regulations, and laws related to safety practices for common and local adolescent activities.

16BD420E7B634605ADD2BC97FE296083.description: Represent a personalized, thoughtful, and coherent understanding of the importance of a healthy attitude toward personal safety.

68D58B60EFC646D5A4A3F2E3C9524817.description: Reflect on and communicate personal and family attitudes towards safety.

FC3397CE0864487FA316A83CE95D4EB4.description: Examine safety risks for common/local adolescent activities (e.g., based on needs and interests of community).

678BDD0347B64E059337CAA7864E5D59.description: Develop and demonstrate the knowledge, skills, and personal standards necessary for establishing and supporting safe practices and environments related to various community activities.

246B3329268B43A591A14A185EDBD6FF.description: Examine personal standards related to body image that enhance the health of self, family, and community.

EC8BFB9BB6894676A14B60C767B7E8AD.description: Examine how the health of a community can be affected (both positively and negatively) by people’s perceptions of body image

589C86E4C3D84045AD6B40F8AD4C4026.description: Compare the strategies used by the cosmetic and diet industries to those of the tobacco industry.

F5B3F84F8EA04A88B07FCCB06C314B63.description: Critique strategies used by advertisers and others within mass media to influence perceptions about appearance and articulate the related impact on the health (i.e., physical, social, emotional, spiritual) of self, family, and community.

53877AC1FE3A4243AF22976978E27DD5.description: Propose reasons (including that the cosmetic and diet product industries are assured of growth and profits) why the mass media might portray an “ideal” look that is difficult to achieve and maintain and the impact this has on health and well-being.

A9EE7F38D9B24636A9928E6CE9BACADB.description: Express insights about the influences on perceptions of body image.

6D1DAC17CE5740F9A22BD77B75245CCD.description: Investigate how one’s identify is influenced by own and other’s perceptions related to appearance.

EF9535ABE0F9496AB276C64F6B22AB9C.description: Illustrate how personal standards influence the kinds of decisions made in relation to personal appearance.

842883747C594A53A27BB3C52C3DC649.description: Investigate the connections among how we look, how we feel, and how we behave.

A1145B1B8BA1412B8C5CB41E763D7873.description: Conclude that there is a wide and acceptable healthy range in body type.

45279EA162534E67A977D1C4D0297E8A.description: Discuss stereotypes based on appearances and the importance of not judging self nor others based on appearances.

CF80E9579D0749B7A61C3EBC9FA682F8.description: Identify sources of, and evaluate information about, influences on body image.

F19172D7F7EA4769A15B937A0444B338.description: Analyze the influences (e.g., cultural, social) on perceptions of and personal standards related to body image, and the resulting impact on the identities and the wellbeing of self, family, and community.

4E2DD86D2D06467ABE6F9B9774358BFA.description: Examine how stress may influence (both positively and negatively) personal standards and decisions.

C74549D8A6084A27B9B180EFA0D9AC11.description: Comprehend that stress can be healthy or unhealthy; it is how one responds to/manages stress that affects health.

B4FBEDD62B7E46AC95D7EDD7879BFA9A.description: Determine when anxiety is “normal” and when professional help may be required.

2691F4A4FC0E4984960AFDAC04FD04D9.description: Practise healthy ways of adjusting/responding to stress

7CD83A26D74F4D43A3920CAC1EF43260.description: Propose healthy (e.g., exercise, sleep, self-talk, deep breathing, communicating) and unhealthy ways (e.g., substance abuse, aggression, withdrawal) of managing stress and compare related short-term and long-term consequences (i.e., physical, mental, emotional, spiritual).

48D01DA794A54711891DA15A743A7C05.description: Interview people of various ages and cultures in the community to determine and evaluate common ways of managing stress (e.g., physical activity, dancing, deep breathing, self-talk, smudging, meditation, listening to music).

FD6383E307F94C8187943C7D31656437.description: Examine stressors for which one can plan and/or over which one has control.

A8E5966D177749FEB6397A4959B0B4C0.description: Analyze physical, mental, and emotional responses (both positive and negative) to stress (e.g., heightened alertness, motivation, ‘fight or flight’, illness, withdrawal, difficulty concentrating, difficulty eating and/or sleeping).

281BF27ABF9C45F28B3FE625077E352D.description: Inventory the kinds of situations that may create anxiety for grade 6 students (e.g., family break-up, moving, getting/ unable to afford braces/glasses, public speaking, body image, academic pressure, foster care, death, economic status).

69E63BDF7F9740A7A67221AD6A4B24D4.description: Identify sources of, and evaluate information related to, anxiety and stress.

83038DE87E994C799A74558C2F6AD1A1.description: Assess and demonstrate strategies used to identify and make healthy decisions in stressful situations.

00FBDBFDFE904572A4CFD2F17330E8D8.description: Investigate and communicate what can happen when a holistic approach (body, mind, heart, and spirit) to management of non-curable infections is/is not adopted.

5062A300F0214A6F8CCE955AFDF34BEC.description: Predict what might happen if only one aspect of health (i.e., only the physical) is addressed when a person/community is infected/affected with a non-curable infection.

76DDD1E98E2E42608713304D5C312ED7.description: Form a personal response, in ways that affirm own personal standards, to some of the health challenges facing families and communities in regards to AIDS.

0AC1A009F4014BFEB16F812CBF78F708.description: Analyze the emotional, spiritual, and social aspects of wellbeing that influence and are influenced by non-curable and serious but treatable infections, including HIV/AIDS and Hepatitis C.

9CBE855A1DA04AC68A295D22B34F4DA1.description: Examine how thoughts and feelings about HIV infection might reinforce or challenge personal standards.

9C95AC4B9F72438E83FA265735102B7A.description: Analyze how non-curable infections, including HIV, affect more people than they infect.

5C30DDBB82D54A0DAA99157DF5553420.description: Perceive how beliefs in the myths and assumptions related to the transmission of infections diseases, including HIV/AIDS and Hepatitis C, affect the health and the identities of the individual, family, and community

6970CFB2C6F2421FA3580A8D1C160E0E.description: Describe ways that non-curable infectious diseases, including Hepatitis C and AIDS, are transmitted and explain ways to avoid and/or reduce the risk of infection/co-infection.

63659B251803480F91024BCF38A8B538.description: Discuss standard precautions/strategies to prevent the transmission of infectious diseases (e.g., washing hands, personal protective measures such as not sharing personal items, immunization, insect precautions, needle safety, avoiding other’s body fluids, condoms, sexual abstinence).

33B41ED7393947E78DB4FF554E972D93.description: Identify sources of, and evaluate information about, noncurable and serious but treatable infections, including HIV and Hepatitis C

29D954A78ED84E1AA2C5CB7C731DA236.description: Demonstrate an understanding of how noncurable and serious but treatable infections, including HIV and Hepatitis C infection, are transmitted and how these infections influence the health (i.e., physical, mental, emotional, spiritual) and the identities of self, family, and community.

734BC38BE38E44B28E0E79C906C90C9D.description: Explore and articulate an understanding of socio-economic class, gender, and culture as attributes of identity that are ascribed to groups of people and the ways that preconceptions about people based on these designations can be false, limiting, and harmful.

158D9E29B0874776BFF651FAA6C292CD.description: Propose how the community would be different if stereotypes and biases did not exist.

2E75491325A247EE9C186686BA781B98.description: Examine the characteristics of healthy relationships.

1AB148AA30AB4516AF03AC3C9B02CDEA.description: Investigate (including through drama, dance, music, and/or visual art) what the community would be like if everyone was exactly the same.

688FB2531589459788199A99261BF447.description: Explore stereotypes and beliefs (including but not limited to those related to age, culture, religion, family structures, and sexual orientations), both past and present, that might limit the number and kinds of healthy relationships.

C05190716A4947AB837FAB4B365C1D57.description: Discuss and question stereotypes and biases that exist in the school and community.

3109BE96AA79434B8280729B8CF50F56.description: Articulate a comprehensive understanding of prejudice, stereotype, and bias.

FC6F2E5D6CF6433C8496A250F29FB8A5.description: Identify sources of, and evaluate information about, diversity

362201A8D796423E87424A97480F58E5.description: Shape new thoughts about oneself as an individual who has a unique heritage and particular influences on beliefs, standards, and/or perspectives.

3BF65B4533AD4385B362A6F0140A8015.description: Ask compelling questions to initiate insights as to how people are the same, how people are different, and how individuals are unique.

718D4564E6884C7285739B9C75285396.description: Conclude the importance of respecting facts, evidence, and views of others when engaging in discussions.

CB9A221DEA594A3CA2F72C2075185AAF.description: Appraise the importance of establishing/ maintaining healthy relationships with people from diverse backgrounds who may or may not express differing values, beliefs, standards, and/or perspectives

70C5C3CB83D84CEFA17F5C955985AAC8.description: Determine how decision making is influenced by personal standards.

B1A878C3401F4D32BA0E8BAFDB46DA22.description: Discuss factors that affect the identities of people as a result of colonization.

CDE2B8EDEDF34E4F96C93443E089603B.description: Analyze events or factors that cause people to make decisions that reflect or conflict with their personal standards.

19246F683956462B89F6609D15E69DDB.description: Explore when personal standards may be reinforced or challenged.

D454C784AB23481AACA38C3A171C4084.description: Examine the connections between affirming personal standards and developing identity.

554C24C82BEA45E58C5542A8A257C587.description: Define identity as being related to who we feel we are and how we define ourselves.

B25014D839FA4A16A09E3003B430A2A6.description: Describe healthy attitudes and behaviours that affirm personal standards.

AA5A2190E21041AB9779F777F732337E.description: Investigate (including through drama, dance, music, and/ or visual art) the factors that have the most influence on personal standards.

9536891417BA48C192D366D1D540F025.description: Consider how and why personal values may change (e.g., norms, trends, values/priorities, relationships, critical events).

8CC81BD856CB481C94B22AC0AAE89FB7.description: Uncover personal standards by exploring questions such as: What are the standards that I will expect myself to live by at all times?, What are my standards for dealing with challenges/ problems?, What are the boundaries for the attitudes and actions that I will accept for myself, my peers, my family, and my community?  and What standards are part of my cultural heritage?

1118353A959C4D899A1886F1558D7E78.description: Communicate an informed personal definition of personal standards (e.g., core personal values that are reflected in how you treat yourself, how you treat others, what and how you speak, your behaviours).

CE8E4B1AC86C49528897DFF08FDF43D1.description: Identify sources of, and evaluate information about, personal beliefs and values.

BCF5A6831A794939BEFCCDB8C1AF7F2B.description: Propose why people behave the way they do (e.g., personal beliefs, societal norms).

36313390B80443758558234CCAE2925A.description: Describe values one appreciates in self and in others and explain why.

57031EB1EB8A4E2D84F3543F863F0399.description: Analyze the factors that influence the development of personal standards and identity, and determine the impact on healthy decision making

CEF569BDF88E4E93A3D5A8E440D62312.description: Develop the understanding, skills, and confidences necessary to take action to improve health.
